text: John William Boyd (ca. 1852 - March 10, 1932) was an African-American ex-slave who served as an attorney, magistrate and Republican politician in Tipton County, Tennessee, including serving two terms in the Tennessee House of Representatives."John W. Boyd," This Honorable Body: African American Legislators in 19th Century Tennessee. Tennessee State Library and Archives. ==References== Category:Members of the Tennessee House of Representatives Category:African-American state legislators in Tennessee Category:1850s births Category:1932 deaths Category:Tennessee lawyers Category:Tennessee Republicans Category:People from Tipton County, Tennessee Category:American slaves Category:19th-century American politicians Category:African-American politicians during the Reconstruction Era Category:American freedmen
title: John W. Boyd (Tennessee politician)
